awd_abstract_narration: The Mathematics Process Writing Project builds on two                           previous NSF-supported teacher enhancement projects at                          Mount Holyoke College. Each year, 18 teachers involved                          in Mount Holyoke's SummerMath for Teachers program will                         be selected to write reflective narratives about                                mathematical teaching and learning processes in their own                       classrooms. A semester-long course and a series of                              workshops will support this activity. At the same time,                         project staff will prepare a book of case studies of                            teachers who have participated successfully in these                            inservice activities. These documents will be piloted in                        inservice teacher enhancement programs.                                                                                                                         Cost sharing is provided by local schools and Mount                             Holyoke College in the amount of 42% of the NSF award.
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE TRUSTEES OF MOUNT HOLYOKE COLLEGE
